supportedFormats.title: Supported Contact Table File Types
supportedFormats.subtitle: Our tool supports a wide range of spreadsheet formats, ensuring you can easily batch import your contact data. All conversions are performed locally, guaranteeing your privacy and security.

items.name: Excel Workbook (.xlsx)
items.desc: Compatible with standard files generated by Microsoft Excel 2007 and later. Supports reading the first sheet of all workbooks, perfectly handling Chinese data and large contact records.

items.name: Legacy Excel (.xls)
items.desc: Fully compatible with earlier version Excel file formats (.xls). No need for extra format conversion; you can directly upload and process historical data or files exported from older systems.

items.name: Comma Separated Values File (.csv)
items.desc: The most universal data exchange format. Our tool intelligently identifies different delimiters (like commas, tabs, etc.) and encodings (UTF-8, GBK), effectively preventing garbled data after import.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.subtitle: Quick answers to your questions about data security, conversion compatibility, and more.

items.q: Data Security & Privacy: Will my files be stored or leaked on your server?
items.a: Absolutely not. The core commitment of this tool is ‚Äú100% Offline Conversion.‚Äù Your Excel/CSV file is processed entirely in your browser's memory from upload to VCF generation. It never passes through any external server, technically ensuring the absolute privacy and security of your contact information.

items.q: Garbled Characters (Mojibake) after Import: Why are my contact names scrambled?
items.a:
The VCF file generated by this tool strictly uses UTF-8 encoding, the international standard. Garbled characters are usually caused by the receiving system or application (such as some older Android versions or Outlook) default encoding settings.
üí° Recommendation: Import into modern cloud services like Apple iCloud or Google Contacts, which automatically recognize UTF-8 encoding for correct display of characters.

items.q: Contact Loss: Why is the number of converted records different from the successfully imported count?
items.a:
A VCF card must meet minimum import requirements. If your table record lacks a Full Name/Display Name (FN) or a Mobile Phone Number (TEL;CELL), that record will be considered invalid and skipped.
‚úÖ Solution: Please return to the converter's Step 2 (Field Mapping) and ensure these two data columns in your source file are complete and correctly mapped.

items.q: VCF Version Choice: Which version offers the best compatibility?
items.a: We default to generating files using the vCard 3.0 version. This is currently the most widely compatible version in the industry, correctly recognized and imported by the vast majority of modern platforms and systems, including Apple iOS, Google Android, and major email services.

howItWorks.title: Batch Import Your Contacts in Three Quick Steps

We support mainstream formats like .xlsx, .xls, and .csv. Rest assured, your file is processed entirely in your local browser‚Äîno uploading, no storage, and no viewing of any sensitive contact data. Your privacy and security are guaranteed.

steps.title: Accurately Map Table Columns to VCF Fields
steps.desc:
üí° Action: Match your column names (e.g., 'Name,' 'Mobile') one-by-one to the VCF standard fields (FN, TEL).

Key points for this step:
  • Required Validation: Ensure the Full Name and Mobile Number core fields are mapped.
  • Data Preview: View the first few data samples in real-time to confirm mapping accuracy and prevent conversion errors.

steps.title: One-Click Download and Import VCF
steps.desc:
üí° Action: Click ‚ÄúStart Conversion,‚Äù then download the generated VCF file.

After conversion, you will receive a standard VCF 3.0 file (UTF-8 encoded). You can:

  • PC: Send the VCF to your computer for bulk import via iCloud or Google Contacts.
  • Mobile: Directly tap to import on your iOS or Android device, efficiently updating your address book.

faq.q: What is a VCF/VCard file, and what is its relation to contacts?
faq.a: VCF (Virtual Contact File), commonly known as VCard, is a standard file format for storing personal or business contact information (like name, phone, email, address, etc.). It is the most common format for bulk importing contacts to smartphones (iOS/Android) and major email clients. With our tool, you can easily fulfill your need for CSV to VCard (VCF) conversion.

faq.q: How do you guarantee my data security? Will the data be uploaded to the server?
faq.a: We take your data privacy very seriously. This tool uses **completely local conversion** technology, meaning your CSV or Excel file remains in your browser from start to finish and **is never uploaded to any external server**. This guarantees that your private data is absolutely secure, resulting in a **zero-leakage, risk-free** conversion process.

faq.q: Besides CSV, does it support converting Excel (XLSX) files to VCF format?
faq.a: Yes, our tool supports not only standard **CSV to VCF** conversion but is also fully compatible with Excel files (including `.xlsx` and the older `.xls` format). The conversion logic automatically identifies the worksheet data within the Excel file and guides you through the field mapping to achieve **Excel to VCF** bulk import.

faq.q: What is the difference between VCF 4.0 and 3.0, and which should I choose?
faq.a: VCF 4.0 is the newest VCard standard, supporting more fields and complex data structures (like multiple social accounts, high-res photos). VCF 3.0 is an older, more widely compatible standard. If unsure, we recommend defaulting to **VCF 4.0** for the best results; if the import fails, try switching to version 3.0.

faq.q: What is a VCF/VCard file, and what is its relation to contacts?
faq.a: VCF (Virtual Contact File), commonly known as VCard, is a standard format for storing contact information. It is the most common format for **bulk importing contacts** to mobile phones (iOS/Android) or email clients. Our tool supports efficient **CSV/Excel to VCard (VCF)** conversion.

faq.q: Besides CSV, does it support converting Excel (XLSX) files to VCF format?
faq.a: Yes, our tool supports not only standard **CSV to VCF** conversion but is also fully compatible with Excel files (including `.xlsx` and the older `.xls` format). The conversion logic automatically identifies the worksheet data and guides you through field mapping to achieve **Excel to VCF** bulk import.

faq.q: Is my contact data secure when using an Excel file for conversion?
faq.a: Absolutely. Whether it's **Excel to VCF** or CSV conversion, we use **completely local processing** technology. Your original Excel file or any contact data never leaves your browser environment and **will never be uploaded to our servers**. This ensures the highest level of security for your private data.

faq.q: Will Chinese or special characters in my Excel spreadsheet appear garbled after conversion?
faq.a: No. When processing **Excel to VCF**, our tool automatically handles UTF-8 encoding to ensure Chinese, Japanese, special symbols, and other characters are correctly identified and written into the VCF file. The generated VCF file uses standard UTF-8 encoding, the recommended format for all mainstream phones and apps, effectively preventing the common **Chinese character garbling** issue.

faq.q: My Excel file is an older version (XLS); can it still be converted?
faq.a: This tool offers robust compatibility. It supports not only the latest **XLSX to VCF** but also fully supports older Excel files (`.xls`). Regardless of your Excel version, simply ensure your contact data is on the first worksheet to smoothly complete the **Excel to VCard** process.

ui.securityDesc: This conversion is completed entirely in your local browser; data does not pass through the server, ensuring zero risk and zero leakage.

faq.q: What is a VCF/VCard file, and what is its relation to contacts?
faq.a: VCF (Virtual Contact File), commonly known as VCard, is a standard format for storing contact information. It is the most common format for **bulk importing contacts** to mobile phones (iOS/Android) or email clients. Our tool supports efficient **CSV/Excel to VCard (VCF)** conversion.

faq.q: I have multiple columns like 'Mobile,' 'Home Phone' in my Excel. How do I map them separately to VCF?
faq.a: During the **Excel to VCF** process, our mapping interface allows you to designate different Excel columns to different VCard properties (e.g., `TEL;TYPE=CELL` for mobile, `TEL;TYPE=HOME` for home phone, `EMAIL` for email, etc.). Simply select the corresponding VCard tag for each column in **Step 2 (Field Mapping)** for fine-grained data import.

faq.q: What are the main uses for converting a VCF file to Excel or CSV?
faq.a:
Performing **VCF Bulk to Excel** or CSV serves three main purposes:
  • **Batch Editing & Cleaning:** Excel offers powerful sorting, filtering, and search functions, making it easy to perform unified format correction and data cleaning on thousands of contacts.
  • **Universal Backup:** Exporting contact data to Excel or CSV files for long-term storage and backup in a universal format.
  • **System Import Preparation:** Many business or CRM systems only support importing CSV or Excel files, making it easy to prepare the data source using this feature.

faq.q: Will all my contact information (like notes, addresses) be fully preserved when converting VCF to Excel?
faq.a: Yes. When performing **VCF to Excel**, our parser comprehensively extracts all fields supported by the VCard standard, including name, phone, email, company, job title, address, and even **contact notes**. This data will be presented in Excel/CSV as separate columns, ensuring **complete data conversion** without any loss of key information.

faq.q: Can I upload multiple VCF files or one VCF file containing multiple contacts?
faq.a: No problem. Our tool supports uploading a single VCF file containing multiple contacts at once, or selecting multiple independent `.vcf` files simultaneously. Our tool automatically identifies and parses all contact records, then **merges** them into a unified Excel or CSV spreadsheet for easy **VCF import to Excel** organization.

faq.q: What is the Chinese character encoding handling mechanism in Excel/VCF conversion?
faq.a: Whether it's **Excel to VCF** or **VCF to Excel**, we use standard UTF-8 encoding throughout the process. This ensures Chinese, Japanese, Korean, and other special characters are accurately written to the VCF or exported to the Excel/CSV file, completely resolving common **Chinese character garbling** issues.

faq.q: What versions of Excel and VCF files does this tool support?
faq.a:
This tool offers robust file compatibility:
  • **Excel/CSV:** Supports reading `.xlsx`, `.xls`, and `.csv` files. Export options include CSV or Excel format.
  • **VCF:** Fully compatible with both VCF 3.0 and VCF 4.0 standard formats. Highest compatibility is ensured for both VCF import and export.

faq.q: Is it safe to use VCF files for reverse conversion?
faq.a: Rest assured, whether it's the forward **Excel to VCF** or the reverse **VCF to Excel**, we consistently use **completely local processing** technology. Your VCF file or any contact data is never uploaded to any server; all computation is done in your browser, ensuring the highest level of security for your data privacy.

seo.title: Cookie Policy
seo.description: Explains the types and purposes of cookies used on this site and user choices.

cookie.title: Cookie Policy
cookie.contentHtml:
This website uses cookies and similar technologies to distinguish you from other users, helping us provide you with a better experience and allowing us to improve the site.

1. Types and Purposes of Cookies

  • Strictly Necessary Cookies: These are essential for basic website functions, such as remembering your session information and locally storing your conversion history settings.
  • Analytical/Performance Cookies: We use these cookies to recognize and count the number of visitors and to see how visitors use our website. This helps us understand which features are most popular (e.g., VCF to Excel vs. Excel to VCF), thereby improving how the website works.
  • Functionality Cookies: Used to recognize you when you return to our website, allowing us to personalize content for you and remember your preferences (such as language or display settings).

2. Your Choices

Most browsers allow you to manage cookie preferences. You can set your browser to refuse all or some cookies. Please note that if you choose to disable strictly necessary cookies, some features of the website may not function correctly.

This website **VCF2XLS.com** and all of its content, features, and functionality (including but not limited to all information, software, text, displays, images, video and audio, and the design, selection, and arrangement thereof) are owned by [Your Company/Individual Name] and are protected by Chinese and international copyright, trademark, patent, trade secret, and other intellectual property or proprietary rights laws.

2. Permitted Use

Unless expressly permitted otherwise in writing, you must not copy, distribute, modify, create derivative works of, publicly display or perform, republish, download, store, or transmit any of the material on our website, except as follows:

  • Your computer may temporarily store copies of such materials in RAM incidental to your accessing and viewing those materials.
  • You may print or download one reasonable number of copies of pages for your own personal, non-commercial use.

3. Trademarks

seo.title: Privacy Policy
seo.description: Clear statement that data is processed entirely in the local browser and is not uploaded to any server.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.contentHtml:
VCF2XLS Commitment: All file conversion operations are completed within your local browser. Your files, or any contact information contained therein, are never uploaded, stored, or transmitted to VCF2XLS or any third-party servers. File data is destroyed as soon as you close the browser or leave the page.

1. Types of Information We Collect

Given that our service is fully localized, we do not collect the content of the files you upload.

  • Non-Personal Information: We may use third-party analytics services (like Google Analytics) to collect anonymous information about how you use this website, including access time, device type, browser version, and pages visited. This information is used solely to optimize website performance and user experience.
  • Contact Information: If you voluntarily contact us via support email or contact form, we will only retain the email address and communication content you actively provide for the purpose of responding and resolving your inquiries.

2. Use of Information

We use non-personal information only for the following purposes:

  • Maintaining and improving the functionality and performance of the VCF2XLS website.
  • Analyzing usage trends to better understand user needs.
  • Responding to your support requests.

3. Third-Party Links

This website may contain links to third-party websites. We assume no responsibility for the privacy practices of such websites. We advise you to read the privacy policy of any third-party website.

seo.title: Terms of Service
seo.description: Defines user rights and obligations and disclaimers when using this service.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.contentHtml:
1. Acceptance and Use of Service

By using VCF2XLS, you agree to comply with these Terms of Service. This service is intended to provide secure, local conversion services between VCard and Excel/CSV file formats.

2. User Responsibilities

  • Data Legality: You warrant that you own or have the right to use all files (VCF, Excel, CSV) and the data they contain uploaded for conversion. You must not use this service to process illegal, infringing, or protected material.
  • Risk Assumption: While this service strives for conversion accuracy, you understand and agree that format differences may exist during the conversion process. You are responsible for checking and verifying the converted data before importing it into any system.

3. Disclaimer of Warranties

The service is provided on an ‚Äúas is‚Äù and ‚Äúas available‚Äù basis. VCF2XLS does not warrant that the service will be uninterrupted, error-free, or completely accurate. We expressly disclaim liability for any direct, indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from the use or inability to use this service, including but not limited to loss of data or loss of profit.

4. Intellectual Property

This website, its source code, design, Logo (VCF2XLS), and all content are owned by VCF2XLS and are protected by copyright law.

faqPage.title: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faqPage.subtitle: Quick answers to your questions about data security, conversion compatibility, and more.
faqPage.q1: Will my VCF or Excel file be uploaded to the server?
faqPage.a1: Absolutely not. The core advantage of VCF2XLS is that data is processed entirely within your local browser. File content never leaves your device, ensuring the highest level of data privacy and security.
faqPage.q2: What should I do if the imported contacts show garbled Chinese characters?
faqPage.a2: Garbling typically occurs during the Excel/CSV to VCF process. Please ensure your original CSV file is saved with **UTF-8 encoding**. Our tool generates VCF files in UTF-8 by default, which is the standard method for resolving Chinese character garbling. If the problem persists, try reopening the CSV in Excel, saving it as UTF-8, and then re-uploading.
faqPage.q3: After VCF to Excel conversion, some fields like 'Notes' or 'Multiple Phones' are missing?
faqPage.a3:
Our tool's parser is designed to identify and extract all standard and non-standard fields in VCF.
  • For **multiple identical fields** (e.g., two mobile numbers), we will either merge them into the same cell or create separate columns in Excel (e.g., 'Phone 1', 'Phone 2').
  • If your VCF contains non-standard data, please send the VCF file to us for analysis, and we will update the parsing logic to support that field as soon as possible.
faqPage.q4: Are there limits on file size or the number of contacts?
faqPage.a4: Since conversion is performed locally, file size mainly depends on your device's performance (CPU and memory). Theoretically, there are no strict limits, but processing VCF files containing over **50,000 contacts** may take a significant amount of time, so please be patient.

changelog.title: Product Update Log
changelog.intro: We are committed to continuously improving VCF2XLS's conversion accuracy and user experience.

v2.title: V2.0.0 - Bi-Directional Conversion Engine Officially Released
v2.p1: New Feature: Introduced the VCF file parsing engine, enabling the reverse conversion feature: **VCF ‚Üí Excel/CSV**.
v2.p2: New Feature: Supports VCF 4.0 specification, fully extracting complex fields such as address, organization, and notes.
v2.p3: Optimization/Improvement: Optimized the field mapping interface for the Excel ‚Üí VCF process, supporting more custom tags.
v2.p4: Optimization/Improvement: Performance boost: local processing speed for large data files (10k+ contacts) increased by 30%.

v1_1.title: V1.1.0 - CSV Garbled Data Fix and Compatibility Enhancement
v1_1.p1: Optimization/Improvement: Forced VCF file export to use UTF-8 encoding, completely resolving Chinese character set garbling issues.
v1_1.p2: Bug Fix: Fixed an issue where column headers were not correctly recognized when uploading specific Excel version (XLS) files.

v1_0.title: V1.0.0 - Initial Release
v1_0.p1: New Feature: Implemented basic **Excel/CSV ‚Üí VCF** conversion functionality.
v1_0.p2: New Feature: Implemented local processing to ensure data security.
